example.eg: We had found a dollar on the ground.
example.egtrans: 我们在地上发现了一美元。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 发现，碰上, 找到，找回

example.eg: The city was founded centuries ago.
example.egtrans: 这个城市建立于很多个世纪以前。

example.eg: The scientist founded his theory on the work of his mentor.
The metal is founded in the furnace.
example.egtrans: 金属是在熔炉里铸造的。

example.eg: I found ten dollars in the street yesterday.
example.egtrans: 昨天我在街上捡到了十美元。

example.eg: I found John at the station waiting for a taxi.
example.egtrans: 我偶然遇见约翰在车站等出租车。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 偶然遇到, 意外碰见

example.eg: I lost my phone last week but I found it this morning.
example.egtrans: 我上周丢了手机，但今天早上找到了。

example.eg: I find modern music rather repetitive.
example.egtrans: 我觉得现代音乐翻来覆去总是那一套。

example.eg: The jury found the defendant guilty on all charges.
example.egtrans: 陪审团裁决被告所有指控罪名全都成立。

example.eg: We found that the cars performed just as well as each other.
example.egtrans: 我们发觉这些车每辆性能都一样好。

dsense.name: find
dsense.guideword: informal (discovery, [sth] found) (有价值或趣味之物)

example.eg: This rare book was really quite a find.
example.egtrans: 这部珍本真算得上是一大发现。

example.eg: Leave everything exactly as you found it.
example.egtrans: 严格保持你发现它时的原状。

example.eg: It is a problem, and we must find the solution to it.
example.egtrans: 这是个问题，我们必须找出解决方案。

example.eg: The team's find made them famous.
example.egtrans: 该团队的发现让他们一举成名。

dsense.name: found [sth] on [sth]
dsense.guideword: (base on, build on a basis of)

example.eg: Gandhi's movement was founded on the premise of non-violence.
Collins was found out because his fingerprints were discovered at the scene of the crime.

dsense.name: found object
dsense.guideword: (art: [sth] not usually used for art) (艺术家用以创作的随手拾来的材料)

example.eg: Duchamp's urinal is a classic example of the artistic use of found objects.
After visiting Japan, I have a newfound love of sushi.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 装备完善的，设备齐全的
